item.title: Find and replace with a newline in Visual Studio Code
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned How to find and replace with a newline in Visual Studio Code.

In the local searchbox (Ctrl + F) you can insert newlines by pressing Ctrl + Enter.

item.title: Azure Pipelines Container Agents for Azure Devops
item.author: Author
item.description: Create self-hosted Azure Pipelines Container Agents for Azure Devops.

item.title: Programmatically Create Azure Pipelines
item.author: Author
item.description: This script New-AzPipeline lets you programmatically create Azure Pipelines based on your folder structure.

item.title: Get Azure VM Cores (vCPUs) per Region
item.author: Author
item.description: If you need a script which outputs you the overall VMCore amount per region, there you go.

item.title: Set primary IP address order with multiple IP addresses on a NIC
item.author: Author
item.description: If you’re running a webserver it may be you have to run different services on the same port and need to use multiple IP addresses on the same network interface. This can happen for SMTP or Exchange Servers using several connectors.

item.title: Expired Azure credentials
item.author: Author
item.description: In case you get this error below, this error is mostly due to outdated Modules or at least in this case the AzureRM module.

item.title: Get-LogonHistory: Who was logged on to my server?
item.author: Author
item.description: Every System Administrator comes into a situation where you want to see who and how many users were logged on to your servers either via Remote Desktop or via script.

item.title: Get-PSVersions: Retrieve Powershell version remotely
item.author: Author
item.description: Okay at the end it’s a simple $PSVersion wrapped in an Invoke-Command but hey these simple things are needful in case you need to run it against of 100s of servers and not just locally. With the help of Invoke-Command via WinRM and $PSVersionTable.psversion wrapped in a foreach you can retrieve PowerShell version of your remote computers indifferent if you need to use credentials to run it against a different domain than you currently reside.

item.title: Resolve-DnsNames: Resolve DNS or IP for multiple Computers
item.author: Author
item.description: Respective Microsoft’s Technet article regarding Resolve-DnsName I have created a function with the ability to run it against more than only one computer. item.author: Author
item.description: Get DELL Tag and Express Service Code remotely for more than one computer.
